Hi there! I’m Benjamin Bellier, 25 years old, scientist by training <i class="fas fa-flask"></i> nerd by nature <i class="fas fa-laptop-code"></i> and sports addict <i class="fa-solid fa-football"></i> by… questionable life choices.

I study how aquatic animals <i class="fas fa-water"></i> deal with stress : pollution, temperature shifts, etc. Basically, I try to speak up for beautiful creatures  <i class="fas fa-fish"></i> that can’t file complaints about their living conditions (but really, really should). Right now, I’m looking for a PhD <i class="fas fa-graduation-cap"></i> to dive deeper into these topics, ideally in an interdisciplinary project tackling chemical pollution in a local, real-world context.

When I’m not elbow-deep in data or on the field, you’ll find me geeking out over video games <i class="fa-solid fa-gamepad"></i> and yes, I unapologetically count RStudio <i class="fa-solid fa-magnifying-glass-chart"></i> as one of them. Debugging code for hours? I love it. Plotting 10 versions of the same graph? Sign me up.

On the sport side of things: I used to race bikes <i class="fas fa-bicycle"></i> at a high level — even won a national cup — and now I’m part of a friendly and diverse crew  that includes riders of all ages (hi, Dad!). These days I train for long-distance triathlons <i class="fa-solid fa-person-swimming"></i> <i class="fas fa-bicycle"></i> <i class="fa-solid fa-person-running"></i> and regularly question my life choices around kilometer 47.

Also, fun fact: I spent a year in Costa Rica backpacking <i class="fas fa-globe-americas"></i> fruit-binging <i class="fas fa-lemon"></i> wildlife-chasing <i class="fas fa-camera"></i> and befriending literally every dog <i class="fas fa-dog"></i>. I met. I’m still not sure whether I miss the mangoes or the mutts more.
